revised_title: Successful Extraction of a Stone and Bone from the Bladder
tldr: This article describes a unique surgical procedure performed by Mr. Joseph Warner to remove a stone and a piece of bone from a patient's bladder. The patient had been suffering from the symptoms of a bladder stone for two years. Mr. Warner used a new method of cutting the urethra obliquely, which allowed for easier access to the bladder and reduced incontinence. The surgery was successful, and the patient was able to retain urine and recover fully.
